metadata.title: Frequently Asked Questions
metadata.description: Answers to common questions about this site, content, and more.

faqs.question: How can I get an update when a new post comes out?
faqs.answer: Subscribe on my substack I'll shoot weakly updated out there. There is also an RSS feed available at /rss.xml.

faqs.question: Do you open source the code used for data anlaysis in your posts?
faqs.answer: Yes there is a repo on my github titled site-architecture which holds scripts used here on krisyotam.com, and on krisyotam.net.

faqs.question: What if I see something incorrect in the post?
faqs.answer: Send me an email at krisyotam@protonmail.com if you have questions or find errors. Thanks ðŸ˜Š! But time of one person is limited and I'm really busy nowadays, so there may take some time for me to get to process it.

faqs.question: Can I translate your posts to another language?
faqs.answer: Yes and my pleasure! But please email me in advance and please keep the original post link on top.

faqs.question: Do you update your old posts?
faqs.answer: Yes, I update my old posts periodically. You can view recent updates via the changelog at /changelog or get them via my substack.

faqs.question: How can you keep up blogging?
faqs.answer: "Pain is inevitable but suffering is optional" --- this is the first sentence of Haruki Murakami's book "What I Talk About When I Talk About Running". I love that book. His altitude towards running is pretty much aligned with how I feel about maintaining this blog.
